titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tom Davis Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday May 7, 2019 at 03:02

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection comprises the papers of comedian and writer Tom Davis. Davis was best known for being one-half of the comedy duo Franken & Davis, with comedian, writer, and former United States Senator Al Franken, and for their work as writers and performers on the television program, Saturday Night Live . Materials in the collection document Davis' life and work, and include scripts, episode rundowns, and other materials related to Saturday Night Live ; writings by Davis, including movie screenplays and drafts of his memoir, 39 Years of Short-Term Memory Loss ; correspondence; photographs; clippings; audiovisual materials; and ephemera.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection comprises the papers of comedian and writer Tom Davis. Davis was best known for being one-half of the comedy duo Franken & Davis, with comedian, writer, and former United States Senator Al Franken, and for their work as writers and performers on the television program, Saturday Night Live . Materials in the collection document Davis' life and work, and include scripts, episode rundowns, and other materials related to Saturday Night Live ; writings by Davis, including movie screenplays and drafts of his memoir, 39 Years of Short-Term Memory Loss ; correspondence; photographs; clippings; audiovisual materials; and ephemera.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

Prior to receipt the collection was preliminarily organized by Jennifer Thompson Elder on behalf of Mimi Raleigh. After receipt the collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization, by Beinecke Library staff

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized in five series: I. Saturday Night Live , 1975-2011; II. Film Projects, 1977-2008; III. Writings, 1977-2012; IV. Personal Papers, 1966-2012; V. Audiovisual Materials, 1977-2009.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Glenn Horowitz Bookseller, Inc. on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2016.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Tom Davis Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Tom Davis (1952-2012) was an American writer and comedian, best known for his comedy writing partnership with Al Franken and their work on the television program, Saturday Night Live (SNL). He was born Thomas James Davis on August 13, 1952 in St. Paul, Minnesota, where he grew up and befriended Franken while both were students at the Blake School in Minneapolis. After graduation, Franken went to college at Harvard University, while Davis attended the University of the Pacific in Stockton, California. Davis withdrew from college after a year and returned to the Twin Cities area to pursue a career in comedy. After Franken graduated from Harvard, the two moved to Los Angeles, California to perform stand-up comedy, and were discovered by SNL creator Lorne Michaels, who hired them as two of the show's first writers. Notably, Franken and Davis were offered a single apprentice job as a duo by the writer's union and were paid a single salary. Their writing credits for SNL were subsequently attributed to "Franken & Davis."

Davis worked for SNL from 1975 to 1980, and again from 1986 to 1994. During his tenure on the show, Davis created or co-created many notable sketches, including "Theodoric of Yorik, Medieval Barber," "Nick the Lounge Singer," "The Continental," and "Coneheads." In addition to his writing work for SNL, Davis wrote many screenplays for films, including the 1993 film, Coneheads . He also wrote several screenplays for films that were never produced, including an adaptation of the Kurt Vonnegut novel, The Sirens of Titan (co-written with Grateful Dead member, Jerry Garcia), and a third installment of the original Ghostbusters film series (co-written with Dan Aykroyd). In 2009, Davis published his memoir, Thirty-Nine Years of Short-Term Memory Loss , and in 2012 he co-authored the book Owsley and Me: My LSD Family with Rhoney Gissen. The latter book chronicled the life of Grateful Dead sound engineer, Owsley "Bear" Stanley and his role in the 1960s counterculture in San Francisco, California.
In 2009, Davis was diagnosed with throat and neck cancer and died on July 19, 2012 at age 59. He was survived by his wife, Mimi Raleigh, whom he married in 1991.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Tom Davis Papers. General Collection of Modern Books and Manuscripts. Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series documents Tom Davis' career as a writer for the television program, Saturday Night Live , as well as his comedy writing partnership with Al Franken, as the duo Franken & Davis. Materials include scripts and rundowns of full episodes of the program; scripts for individual sketches written by Franken and Davis; a grouping of unsorted and unidentified skripts; audiovisual materials; and other related papers, including notes, correspondence, and employment contracts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this sereis document film projects that Tom Davis worked on throughout his professional career, and consist primarily of screenplays. Of note are screenplay drafts for the 1993 film Coneheads, which was based on the Saturday Night Live sktech of the same name; screenplay drafts of an unproduced adaptation of the Kurt Vonnegut novel, Sirens of Titan, co-written with Grateful Dead lead singer Jerry Garcia; and screenplay drafts for an unproduced third installment of the original Ghostbusters film series, co-written with Dan Akroyd.

scopecontent.p: Also identified under the working title Hell in a Bucket .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series primarily consist of drafts of Tom Davis' published memoir, 39 Years of Short-Term Memory Loss. Also included are an assortment or other writings, chiefly one-off scripts for television and radio shows.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes an array of materials related to Tom Davis' personal life, including correspondence, notebooks, photographs, posters, and ephemera. Of particular note are a signed plaque from Steve Martin to Tom Davis, thanking Davis for his contribution to "Steve Martin's Best Show Ever"; a signed typewritten letter to Franken and Davis from Mitzi Shore, owner of the Comedy Store club in Los Angeles; and a collection of original concert posters, most promoted by Bill Graham, for concerts by the Grateful Dead, Jimi Hendrix, Jefferson Airplane, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Materials in this series consist of videocassettes, audiocassettes, CD-R's, film reels, and audio reels that were either collected by Tom Davis, or which contain content documenting his life and work in comedy.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Audiovisual materials related to Saturday Night Live can be found in Series I.
